On Patrice Bergeron: ‚ÄúObviously, the year that he had, I hope he feels as good about his game still because he had a pretty damn good year. Hopefully he‚Äôs mentally prepared to have another one. You‚Äôve got to give him some time to digest all that and talk with his family."

On an extension for Don Sweeney: ‚ÄúI started talking with Charlie and Mr. Jacobs after the deadline about extending Don, so that‚Äôs my plan is to do that...I‚Äôm going to sit down with Don in the next day or two and hopefully hammer something out.‚Äù

On potential changes: "I don‚Äôt think anyone really wants to watch losing hockey. That‚Äôs not the plan, is to start losing...we do have some good young players in this lineup that hopefully we can build around in the next couple years, so we don‚Äôt have to do a complete rebuild.‚Äù

‚ÄúYou‚Äôre always analyzing and dissecting your club throughout the whole year. But the playoffs certainly gave me some indication that we‚Äôve got to do a little better job of getting inside the dots."

üé• Erik Haula on his first season with the #NHLBruins: ‚ÄúTough start. But I‚Äôm happy with how it ended, talking about regular season and finding my spot, finding my role here, feeling that sense of belonging. It was fun." https://t.co/NhO44D5GzV

üé• Brandon Carlo on wearing the 'A' at times this season and his growth as a leader: "I definitely feel as though I‚Äôve learned to emulate the way guys lead by example in certain ways...I‚Äôve been lucky enough to have great leadership in front of me to learn from those guys." https://t.co/5RnfuS7QL6

On potential surgery for Brad Marchand: "March is going to have an evaluation hip wise. March was probably the one that was a little more surprising of having some adductor issues in the last couple of years...he's doing more exploratory stuff now to confirm that."

On David Krejci: "I certainly kept in touch with David and his camp throughout the year...I‚Äôm sure at some point in time if he decides he wants to return, then hopefully I get a call and we can have a conversation. But I have not gone down that path for several months.‚Äù

On the series against Carolina: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre disappointed, ultimately, in how we performed throughout the series. Good pockets to it...ultimately, we‚Äôre disappointed we‚Äôre not playing. We have to look internally, first and foremost, at areas that we need to improve."

On a new contract for David Pastrnak: "We'll dive right into it the earliest possible time that we're allowed...there's never been an indication otherwise that this is where he wants to play. He wants to win. He's obviously a great player and an important player for us."

Sweeney on Patrice Bergeron: "We do have to give him all the latitude in the world to make the best decision for he and his family...he‚Äôs given us indications that he‚Äôs not going to hold us up in that sense in terms of what we may have to do subsequent."

"We did not accomplish what we had hoped to do in the course of the season. Only one team does, but we aspire to be that team...we stand here today acknowledging we fell short."
